Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or related field; if no degree, 12+ years of experience in software engineering/developing
Must have extensive programming experience in Java Script, Angular JS Framework, HTML, XML.
Understands technical and functional design requirements related to ServiceNow.
Experience with development and implementation of ServiceNow ITSM modules - Incident Management, Problem Management, Configuration Management, Change Management, Knowledge Management or other ITSM applications.
Experience as a Software Engineer/Cloud Engineer/AWS Architect
Experience with AWS, Service Now
Cloud admin/arch experience
Create automation scripts/utilities, data migration
Experience building Environments for dev/test/prod, rebuilding instances
Experience with PKI setups, certification maintenance
Experience with Dashboard tools, data visualization
Strong understanding of ETL processes
Experience Developing dashboards and updating logic
SQL and relational database experience
Candidate must also be familiar with sound software engineering principles and methodologies
Knowledge of developing in a Windows operating environment
Proven experience in solving challenging technical problems.
Candidate must be able to work in a fast moving environment, adapt to changes in schedules, be courteous and professional when interacting with colleagues and customers, demonstrate a solid ability to solve problems, plan and prioritize personal tasking, effectively communicate verbally and in writing, and be able to work successfully in a team environment.

Stratum Networks is a rapidly growing information assurance and cybersecurity solutions company that provides high-end network and security consulting to Department of Defense and Intelligence Community clients. We are looking for a talented and passionate ServiceNow Developer who would support one of our clients located in the Annapolis Junction, MD area.

CANDIDATES ARE REQUIRED TO HAVE AN ACTIVE TS/SCI WITH POLYGRAPH TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THE POSITION.

Job Description

The candidate will Configure/Customize the ServiceNow system, including creating workflows, build service requests from customer requirements, request items and tasks using workflows to manage data flows from the customer to the support teams providing the service, use scripting tools and ServiceNow functionality to create script to automate rote tasks being done in ServiceNow, perform integrations and process automation using ServiceNow Orchestration, gather specifications from the IT department and deliver a product/release that meets the needs presented. Create requirements definitions and technical specifications documentation plus load, manipulate and maintain data between Service-now and other systems. The candidate will work with IT managers to generate views and reports as needed, analyze and fully understand user requirements and current procedures in order to improve system capabilities, automate process workflows and address scheduling limitations throughout the development and delivery of the ServiceNow roadmap, be competent with ITIL/ITSM processes, perform system and integration testing with sample and live data, monitor health, usage and overall compliance of the application, plus detailed knowledge in CSS and other web technologies. The candidate will assess existing ServiceNow usage and recommend forward evolution of ServiceNow capabilities to maximize their use within the development environment.

Required skills:
Linux/Unix System Administration or development experience
JavaScript or other higher level development languages
Familiarity with Web based user interfaces (HTML, XML, CSS)
Minimum 2 yrs experience as a ServiceNow Developer
Knowledge of the Agile development methodology
Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation
Experienced at extracting requirements through discussions with the user population
Prioritize workload based on internal and external impact
Experience leading a team of three and interfacing with internal teams

Desired skills:
Java Development
ServiceNow Certifications a plus (Administrator, Developer)
Experience in managing a Self-Hosted ServiceNow instance to include performing required upgrades to the ServiceNow Core applications
May be required to respond to after-hours requests as required in a 24 x 7 environment.

DoD 8570 Compliance with IAM level 1 is required.

Labor Category Requirement

Fifteen (15) years experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity within the Federal Government is required. Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required. Five (5) years of additional system administration experience may be substituted for a bachelor’s degree.

Description
Job Description:
Leidos is seeking multiple DevOps Engineers to support a Leidos Prime Program in the development, integration, deployment, and sustainment of critical systems. The DevOps Engineer(s) will:
Support the development life cycle of platform architectural design, deployment and debugging
Building a release pipeline to enable fast, but safe delivery of critical business software to Production
Develop & Maintain sound version control best practices-based CM systems (GIT), including branching and merging strategies
Ability to automate release deployments across development, test, staging, Quality Assurance and production stacks using a combination of scripting languages and other automation toolkits
Maintain / upgrade / patch tracking and documentation software (Confluence / Jira)
Create, Assist, and/or Implement design and maintenance web service infrastructure and deployments
Identify processes and capabilities that can be streamlined and automated
Leverage programming Languages such as Python, Ruby, Perl, and Java (U) Proficient with DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering methodologies
Set up and configure a continuous integration environment by leveraging Configuration Management, containerization, serverless technologies, and Kubernetes
Architect and develop best practices for software build tools (Gradle, Maven, ANT, Shell) and continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Bamboo), and infrastructure automation (Amazon Web Services, VMWare, Puppet, Chef, ansible, etc.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or higher is required in either Engineering (i.e. Computer, Electrical, Mechanical, Aerospace, etc.) or Computer Science with a minimum of eight (8) years of related experience (excludes education experience such as Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in relevant field)
Strong knowledge of Linux and Linux environments (RHEL 6/7/8, RHCSA/RHCE, CentOS)
Must be fluent with Git
5+ years working in an Agile dev environment
Experience integrating Jenkins/Bamboo, Docker, and Kuberenetes for automated deployment preferred
Experience with caching technologies (Memcache, Active MQ, Redis, APC, etc.)
Experience with MySQL (Clusters, Replication, and Tuning) and Elasticsearch (Kibana a plus)
Knowledge of security practices, networking protocols, firewalls, PCI compliance, etc.
5+ years of system architecture required with a demonstrated ability to read the code and understand the coding logic to assist in troubleshooting
Experience with Windows system administration, system monitoring, instrumentation, resiliency and performance
5+ years’ experience managing/monitoring AWS cloud and virtualized servers for optimal
performance while working in a Platform as a Service (PaaS) environment
Familiarity with software development life cycle models, agile, and DevOps programming methodologies
Fluent skills in object oriented programming and experience in at least one programming language, such as Ruby, C, C++, GO, Python, or Java
Experience acquiring in-depth understanding of large complex software systems to isolate defects, reproduce defects, assess risk, and understand varied customer deployments
Ability to successfully work with customers, developers, testing, project management, and support Staff
Excellent problem solving, analytical skills and technical troubleshooting skills
Clarity and precision in verbal and written communications

Data Scientist
Company Description
DataLab USA is an analytics and technology driven database marketing consultancy. We combine sophisticated technology, cutting edge analytics and an intrinsic understanding of marketing to build large-scale addressable marketing programs for Fortune 500 companies. Our clients operate in multiple verticals: Financial Services, Insurance, Telcom, and Travel & Leisure.
Key responsibilities/duties include:
· Build, implement and maintain predictive models through their full lifecycle.
· Identify patterns & trends in data, and provides insights to enhance business decision making.
· Identify challenges and opportunities from client strategy discussions and taking ownership of solution.
· Set up and monitor monthly model recalibration process.
· Generate complex ad-hoc analyses combining disparate concepts or creating new approaches.
· Design and create new analytic procedures & automation.
· Review corporate model scoring QC.
· Review corporate data transformation QC.
Education and Experience:
· MS/PHD in a quantitative discipline or BS in a quantitative discipline with commensurate experience
· Regular SQL use for querying data
· Experience programming with at least one language
· Use of statistical software (e.g., R, Python)
· Experience with Tableau (or other data visualization platform)
· Experience with Excel
· Financial or insurance industry experience strongly preferred
· 3-5 years of Database Marketing and Data Mining experience

The DIA requires skilled expertise in data science.
Create data packages, in the form of databases, reports, and visualization
Communicate ongoing data science activities, technical findings, and data products for both technical and non-technical customers
Extract relevant features from large data stores containing open source, PIA, and CAI, containing bad records, partial records, errors, or other forms of “noiseing.”
Extract features from open source information stored in a wide range of possible formats, including JSON, XML, raw text logs, industry-specific encodings, and graph link data;
Apply natural language processing, computer vision, signal processing, and speaker and speech recognition algorithms to identify objects in text, image, video, and audio files;
Apply descriptive and inferential statistics to describe data and make predictions about the data, including statistical tests to determine confidence for a hypothesis, common summary statistics (e.g. mean, variance, and counts), fit distributions to datasets and use those distributions to predict event likelihoods;
Execute data science method using parallel computing frameworks (e.g. deeplearning4j, Torch, Tensor Flow, Caffe, Neon, NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network library (cuDNN), and OpenCV)) and distributed data processing frameworks (e.g. Hadoop (including HDFS, Hbase, Hive, Impala, Giraph, Sqoop), Spark (inlcuding MLib, GraphX, SQL and Dataframes)
Execute data science method using common programming/scripting languages: Python, Java, Scala, R (statistics).
Utilize statistical techniques to analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of data
Create, validate, and implement data models to solve problems/answer questions
Automate and optimize data extraction, cleaning, processing and analysis functions
Experience:
Mid (5-10 yrs.)
Senior (10+ yrs.)
Security Clearance:
Current and active TS/SCI
Job Type: Full-time

Job Title: Practice Lead, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML)
Job Description:
About the Role
EGlobalTech (EGT), a Tetra Tech Company, is searching for an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Practice Lead to join our R&D Lab, EGTLabs, and support our Technology, Cyber, and Business Solutions Practices. This role will make an immediate impact on customer engagements and the entire organization. This position works with Executive Leadership to develop solutions in machine learning and data science using cutting edge open source technologies for some of our nation’s most pressing issues. Qualified candidates should have expert level experience deploying AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure. We are looking for an innovative leader that wants to #BePartOfTheSolution! EGT offers excellent compensation, career growth potential, and a benefits package that includes PTO and Holidays, continuing training and education reimbursements, 401K match after just 90 days, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and more!
Check out more about EGTLabs below:
https://www.eglobaltech.com/egtlabs
Responsibilities
The Practice Lead, AI/ML will work regularly with an existing customer in the aviation industry to develop and deploy AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.
This role will act as the lead for multiple AI challenges and be responsible for developing innovative solutions to solve our client's most critical problems.
Develop new open source products that scale and are repeatable across a wide customer space
Develop and deploy AI products for a leading customer in the aviation space.
Lead demos and discussions around AI, machine learning, and data science with existing and new customers.
Develop prototypes and demos in Amazon Web Services (AWS) using Python.
Contribute technical expertise to proposals, white papers, and business development activities.
Hands-on algorithm development.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant field
10+ years of experience developing Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML) models and solutions for high visibility stakeholders, preferably for a federal consulting firm.
3+ years of experience working with and developing software prototypes and solutions.
Must have a deep understanding of Python.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
This position requires a badge and or clearance that will require an extensive background, credit, and drug screening requirement.

Data Scientist
TS/SCI Poly
Location: Mclean, VA
Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future
Join the top Information Technology and Analytic professionals in the industry to make invaluable contributions to our national security on a daily basis. In this innovative, self-contained, Big Data environment, the ManTech team is responsible for everything from infrastructure, to application development, to data science, to advanced analytics and beyond. The team is diverse, the questions are thought-provoking, and the opportunities for growth and advancement are numerous
The successful candidate will possess a diverse range of data-focused skills and experience, both technical and analytical. They will have a strong desire and capability for problem solving, data analysis and troubleshooting, analytical thinking, and experimentation.
Duties, Tasks & Responsibilities
· Working with large, complex, and disparate data sets
· Designing and implementing innovative ways to analyze and exploit the Sponsor’s data holdings
· Researching and reporting on a wide variety of Sponsor inquiries
· Raising proactive inquiries to the Sponsor based on observations and proposed data analysis/exploitation
· Solving difficult, non-routine problems by applying advanced analytical methodologies, and improving analytic methodologies
· Developing custom searches
· Communicating and coordinating with internal and external partners as needed
Required Experience, Skills, & Technologies
Thorough knowledge of appropriate analytic tools and methodologies in one or more of the following:
· Applied mathematics (e.g. probability and statistics, formal modeling, computational social sciences)
· Computer programming (e.g. programming languages, math/statistics packages, computer science, machine learning, scientific computing)
· Ability to code or script in one or more general programming language
· Experience with and theoretical understanding of algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and anomaly detection
· Knowledge of relational databases, including SQL and large-scale distributed systems (e.g. Hadoop)
· Expertise with statistical data analysis (e.g. linear models, multivariate analysis, stochastic models, sampling methods)
· Demonstrated effectiveness in collecting information and accurately representing/visualizing it to non-technical third parties
· TS/SCI with Polygraph
· Bachelor of Science or equivalent and 12-15 years related experience, but will consider all levels of experience.
Desired Experience, Skills & Technologies
· Previous investigative experience using a combination of technical and analytic skills

Job Title: Data Analyst for Museum Services Team
Job Description:
The Position:
Service First Consulting works with DC area non profits and Museums to provide staffing resources. This is a 2-year contract position, located at the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum in the Office of Shared Services.
The Junior Data Analyst will be responsible for working with internal clients to create deliverables based on information within SQL databases. The analyst will have the opportunity to work on projects for multiple internal clients and in multiple systems, languages, and software, commensurate with interest and ability.
Qualified applicants must be detail-oriented, results-driven individuals who can take ownership of a project and can work well without direct oversight. They must have good interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to perform duties with a high degree of accuracy. Candidates for this position should have strong computer skills and the ability to maintain a friendly and professional disposition when working with clients. Candidates should also be familiar with analytics, reporting and technical languages and a deep interest in learning about non-profit fundraising and operations.
Major Duties
Working with internal clients, create, manage, and deliver mail, email, and call lists, based on pre-developed and new SQL queries;
Tweak existing SQL queries and create new SQL queries to answer simple analytics questions and develop and improve lists for internal clients;
Document and code all internally produced mass communications with CRM;

Job Summary:
This position will be a hybrid combination of two significant work tasks for the Travel Forecasting Program located in Austin, Texas. The first work item will be to support on-going lead model calibration and validation work, whether it be trip-based or activity-based models. The candidate will be expected to independently direct and train sponsor staff in model calibration and validation by providing technical and analytical lead-level support in travel model development and application along with research and implementation that makes use of existing and emerging techniques, approaches and sources of data to advance the objectives of major sponsors.
The second work task will be substantially involved in the review and analysis of processed and unprocessed travel survey data for use in travel model development and calibration and participate in the assessment of passive sources of travel data to support the update of current models as well as research and test new model structures and methods. The candidate will need to have the capability to be engaged in data analytics and interpretation of large “Big Data” sets. Additional responsibilities include the preparation of professional and technical reports documenting research and data analysis of the work performed.
The ideal candidate will be challenged to take project and task leadership roles in the advancement of modeling procedures in an applied transportation research and application environment and handling a variety of work tasks, with excellent technical and interpersonal skills.
The position will also play a significant role in advancing the strategic goals of the TTI travel forecasting program and will contribute to the identification, pursuit and successful acquisition of research funding in the areas of travel demand and behavior modeling. As such, the position will lead, design, advocate and implement data-driven model development thru collaboration with other researchers and major sponsors – particularly including the use and advancement of passive data utilization in model development.
Continued employment in this position is contingent upon availability of funding and satisfactory performance.
Essential Duties:
Travel model preparation, calibration, and forecasting using traditional travel modeling techniques. Maintain, apply, and calibrate three and four step travel demand models. — 25%
Prepare and test software procedures and program scripts to advance new travel model methods and structures. – 25%.
Coordinate with travel survey researchers on potential impact to model methods and structures if changes to survey data methods and content are driven by the sponsor or changes to survey procedures are enacted. Lead program efforts to research model process advancements resulting from new travel related data sources such as passive data. Act as substantial contributor in the setting of future direction of travel modeling activities and participate in the development of research opportunities and new model architecture platforms for major sponsors using new survey data. – 30%
Manage multiple tasks and independently contribute to extramurally funded research. Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams to perform research, technology transfer, and implementation projects. Build teams within program, division and across TTI. Plan, schedule, supervise, coordinate, and report detailed phases of research projects. Serve as primary contact with sponsors on project tasks and overall projects. Ensure the completion of project objectives and timely delivery of high-quality project deliverables. Manage time, budgets, financial records, and progress of research to meet sponsor expectations - 10%
Mentor and guide less experienced staff to build program and TTI capabilities in advanced travel modeling and forecasting procedures – 9%
Other duties as assigned – 1%
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in applicable field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
8 years practice-based work experience in travel demand/behavior modeling and forecasting and data science.
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated experience related to trip-based model development/calibration, which includes knowledge of demographics, network coding and other travel forecasting steps/procedures.
Technical skills using and developing scripts in TransCAD, Cube or similar travel forecasting software.
Experience in programming languages such as Visual C, Visual C++, Java, HTML, Python, and SQL.
Experience in working with large databases using open-source programing languages and data analytics.
Working knowledge of travel survey data collection methods and structure of travel surveys to support travel demand models including experience in the analysis and use of travel survey data in the development of travel models.
Fundamental skills in statistical analysis of travel model input and outputs.
Experience in reviewing and assessing travel model validation/calibration.
Experience in communicating travel model development, application processes, and results both verbally and in writing.
Professional work experience consulting or directly working with state DOT and MPO agencies in the field of transportation planning.
Ability to train individuals in one-on-one settings or large groups in workshop settings.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision but have the ability to work cooperatively with others on team assignments.
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s and/or PhD in Engineering or Planning or related field with an emphasis in transportation.
Experience with development and/or application of tour-based and activity-based models.
Experience in developing and delivering one-on-one and large group workshops in both trip-based and activity-based models.
Experience in the development of project proposals and in building effective project teams to perform travel behavior/demand modeling research.
Experience in the management of multidisciplinary project teams and effectively manage research tasks and projects.
Experience in analysis of large travel-related data sets such as cell, GPS, LBS or other ‘big data’ sources and use of such data in travel model development and/or results evaluation.
Working knowledge of traffic engineering.
Working knowledge of Cloud Computing (e.g., AWS, Azure) environments for data storage, results hosting, and analysis.
Working experience in versioning host sites like GitHub and some experience in Linux/Bash.
Working experience in Python Data Science packages (Pandas, GeoPandas, Numpy + Plotting packages).

Job Summary
Support the Federal Electronic Health Records Modernization (FEHRM) program office through the analysis and evaluation of data standards and their impact on the implementation of the single, common electronic health record (EHR) across the DOD, VA, and Coast Guard, as well as other aspects of interoperability across the federal sector. Leverage experience with the Office of National Coordination (ONC) to develop strategic planning approaches that consider key factors from across the federal interoperability space and inform the next generation of the FEHRM’s role with interoperability. In coordination with the Departments, apply principles of medical informatics to healthcare information technology with the goal of improving patient care by leveraging the EHR to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of treatment. Liaise with standards development organizations (SDOs) as FEHRM representation to advocate for the interests of the Departments and report information that could impact the implementation of the EHR product to relevant parties. Coordinate across the FEHRM to facilitate a cohesive approach to data standards that aligns with the broader FEHRM interoperability goals. Apply expertise to development of strategic planning for the FEHRM’s data standards and interoperability teams and ensure tactical activities are accomplished in a timely manner.
Qualifications and Skills
· Minimum of 4 years of experience is required. An additional 12 years of relevant experience may be substituted for degree requirements.
· Experience in DOD, VA, or both
· Experience with electronic health records
· Experience with ONC and understanding of ONC policies and activities related to interoperability.
· Understanding of the federal interoperability space and ability to identify gaps and opportunities to improve interoperability.
· Ability to critically and analytically evaluate business drivers, requirements, and stakeholder viewpoints across multiple organizations to provide strategic perspective, creative problem solving, and potential courses of action.
· Excellent communication skills, including ability to present at meetings and workshops on project work and participate in discussions.
· Ability to coordinate with technical professionals and create new approaches and solutions.
· Ability to produce scientific writing, visual presentations (e.g., infographics), and publication submissions (e.g., AMIA, PLOS, HIMSS, Health Affairs)
· Ability to work independently using organizational and time management skills.
· PhD in healthcare, science, computer engineering or related scientific, technical, or clinical discipline
Additional Qualifications:
· Knowledge and experience in terminology standards and current and emerging health data standards
· Knowledge of patient-level healthcare delivery and the interaction of clinical workflows with EHRs
· Knowledge of appropriate data sources to address the specific requirements of projects for monitoring, characterization, analysis, and modeling.
· Knowledge of Cerner capabilities, such as Cerner’s open platforms (Cerner Millennium®, HealtheIntent, CareAware®), Ignite APIs for Millennium, Open Engine, and OPENLink™
Knowledge of CommonWell Health Alliance

Geospatial Data Scientist
Embedded Alliance is recruiting qualified Geospatial Data Scientist candidates to fulfill the duties and responsibilities described in the Position Description below.
NOTE: This position requires a TS/SCI security clearance. Please do not apply if you do not have a security clearance.
Job Description:
The candidate should have a geospatial background and a strong ability to independently conduct research and initiate projects in support of customer objectives. Gather data and present it on reports or on maps. Use a combination of computer and mathematical skills to develop applications and programs that can gather geospatial data. Develop Geographic Information Systems (GIS) that can be used by the intelligence community and or the Military. Responsible for determining how to improve programs to provide users with more effective information.
Required Qualifications:
Active Top Secret/SCI security clearance required.
Bachelor/Master degree with 4+ years in Quantitative discipline such as data science, mathematics, statistics, earth science, quantitative social sciences, geographic information science, computer science, physics, etc., or relevant discipline experience.
Experience processing geospatial data including Georeferencing, orthorectifying and mosaicking imagery, re-projecting, routing. Familiarity with aeronautical and nautical charts as well as terrain data.
Expertise skills in programming, analytical, mathematical, problem-solving.
Strong analytical skills, teaching skills, teamwork skills, technical skills.
Develop scripts and algorithms (e.g. Python), create explanatory and predictive models, and conduct comparative analyses to address complex GEOINT problems.
Create, edit, research, evaluate, analyze, and fuse data from multiple sources and datasets to produce current and finished geospatial intelligence products.
Develop and apply methods to identify, collect, process, and analyze large volumes of data to build and enhance products, processes, and systems.
Solve and automate classification, regression, cluster analysis, anomaly detection, association discovery, and topic modeling tasks.
Develop and utilize solutions with predictive patterns from data into practical, intelligent applications that anyone can use.
Create and maintain geodatabases and integrate and manage foundation, intelligence, and multi-INT data into structured geodatabases.
Create explanatory and predictive models and conduct comparative analyses to address complex military and intelligence problems.
Desired Qualifications:
Experience with the following software packages and technologies: ArcGIS, Python, R, Tableau.
Familiarity with geospatial charts as well as terrain data.
Experience conducting training sessions.
About Embedded Alliance:
Embedded Alliance is a certified veteran, minority, woman owned small business focused on merging database management and visualization techniques to drive GOEINT analysis; working with our partners and community to provide innovative geospatial solutions.
If you have what it takes, join us. Embedded Alliance is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required.

Job Description:
About the Role
EGlobalTech (EGT), a Tetra Tech Company, is searching for an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Practice Lead to join our R&D Lab, EGTLabs, and support our Technology, Cyber, and Business Solutions Practices. This role will make an immediate impact on customer engagements and the entire organization. This position works with Executive Leadership to develop solutions in machine learning and data science using cutting edge open source technologies for some of our nation’s most pressing issues. Qualified candidates should have expert level experience deploying AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure. We are looking for an innovative leader that wants to #BePartOfTheSolution! EGT offers excellent compensation, career growth potential, and a benefits package that includes PTO and Holidays, continuing training and education reimbursements, 401K match after just 90 days, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and more!
Check out more about EGTLabs below:
https://www.eglobaltech.com/egtlabs
Responsibilities
The Practice Lead, AI/ML will work regularly with an existing customer in the aviation industry to develop and deploy AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.
This role will act as the lead for multiple AI challenges and be responsible for developing innovative solutions to solve our client's most critical problems.
Develop new open source products that scale and are repeatable across a wide customer space
Develop and deploy AI products for a leading customer in the aviation space.
Lead demos and discussions around AI, machine learning, and data science with existing and new customers.
Develop prototypes and demos in Amazon Web Services (AWS) using Python.
Contribute technical expertise to proposals, white papers, and business development activities.
Hands-on algorithm development.

10+ years of experience developing Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML) models and solutions for high visibility stakeholders, preferably for a federal consulting firm.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
This position requires a badge and or clearance that will require an extensive background, credit, and drug screening requirement.

To achieve this objective, our core practice areas – strategy, IT solutions development, cyber security, and cloud computing – are integrated to provide clients with comprehensive end-to-end results. We need your help! We’re looking for a self-motivated and detail-oriented data engineer to join our DataOps team. This opportunity will enable you contribute to the operation, support, and enhancement of our mission critical data operations platform and the development of data pipelines. Our data operations platform supports high volume, high velocity data ingestion and curation to support our existing, and rapidly expanding, health plan client base.
What You’ll Do
As a data engineer, you will be responsible for the execution and management of inbound client and internal service-based data pipelines. This encompasses the development, operation, and management of our client data hubs, including data intake, data quality assessment/evaluation and data curation and enrichment/preparation processes. Our client data hubs consist of various health plan data sources to support Decision Point services including our AI/ML platform, analytics platform, and OPUS application. If this interests you, read on.
The Position
Design and develop scalable data integration (ETL/ELT) processes (including ingestion, cleansing, curation, unification, etc.)
Automate the processing of inbound client data feeds
Design and develop tools to support data profiling and data quality methodologies
Work with our data science team to assist with data prep, enrichment and feature engineering for AI/ML
Engage with our software engineering team to ensure precise data points per application specification
Provide periodic support to our customer success team
Skills & Experience
BS / MS in Computer Science, Engineering or applicable experience
3+ years of experience with ETL/ELT and data pipeline principles
3+ years of experience with Python, JavaScript, and/or PowerShell
3+ years of SQL experience; Microsoft SQL Server or PostgreSQL preferred
Knowledge of data manipulation methodologies
Excellent verbal and written communication
Strong data profiling skills; Ability to discover and highlight unique patterns/trends within data to identify and solve complex problems
Keen understanding of EDW and other database design principles
Comfortable working with very large data sets and VLDB environments
Experience with CI/CD and version control tools: Git preferred
Understanding of data science and machine learning concepts preferred
Experience working within hybrid cloud environment; AWS experience is a plus
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or QuickSight is a plus
Familiarity with healthcare data is a plus
Some familiarity with statistical software tools and libraries such as R and scikit-learn is a plus

Mulligan Funding is a leading working capital lender providing businesses across the country with the capital they need to successfully compete, grow and thrive. With over $450M in funding to thousands of businesses throughout the country, Mulligan Funding is entering a new stage of growth.
We are seeking an Analyst to join our quantitative and data science team. If you have exceptional analytical, quantitative and problem-solving skills, creativity, drive, a desire to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and to make a direct impact on the success of the business, this is an opportunity for you. The ideal candidate has strong inner motivation to learn and grow on the job, intellectual curiosity, exceptional attention to detail, and excellent interpersonal skills.
Core Responsibilities
Assemble, process, and analyze raw data from all business areas of the company
Support aspects of data analysis for development of statistical models
Build and automate financial and data reports for use by company leadership
Build financial analyses in Microsoft Excel or similar software
Deliver key insights from data analysis in the form of presentation materials
Own the accuracy and precision of analysis
Support development of code for statistical modeling
Work under the guidance of Head of Analytics, and with members of the Analytics and Technology teams

B.A. or B.S. in Economics, Statistics, Finance, or similar quantitative field from a top university, and course work or project experience in analytics
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills
Experience with statistical methods and data analysis
Some programming experience, e.g. in Python or another language
Experience with Microsoft Excel
Independence in problem solving
Strong attention to detail, ability to spot and fix problems, and organization skills
Ability and desire to work collaboratively
Intellectual curiosity and creativity
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Preferred Qualifications
Knowledge of Python or R
Familiarity and experience with SQL
Working knowledge of data analysis and visualization tools, such as PowerBI or Tableau
Some work or internship experience in a relevant field
What We Offer
Competitive compensation package
Great Medical, Vision and Dental Benefits
401K with matching contribution
Sick, Vacation, and Holidays
Gym membership contribution
A dynamic, growing team in a highly regarded organization
Start-up culture, within an established business with 10 years of experience
Flexibility to work remote full-time during Covid-19 pandemic

Job Title: Big Data Principal Software Engineer
Location: Remote
Duration: Full Time
Description:
You will work with our top engineers across our application, platform, data science, and UI teams to implement a cutting-edge customer data platform that will challenge you and your teammates technically and intellectually. Daily you will be working with other engineers, product managers, and QA to invent the best solutions for our customers and advance our leadership position in CDP and ABM fields. You should feel confident in your development skills and also open to diverse opinions so that you can make the decisions on how to build our best solutions. Our culture is built on mentorship, so you should be prepared to learn from others and also teach others. As a Senior/Lead Software Engineer you will be expected to work on projects as a technical lead and give guidance to other members on technical design and overall on best practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for leading the design and development of a Big Data predictive analytics SaaS based customer data platform using object oriented analysis, design and programming skills, and design patterns
Implement ETL workflows for data matching, data cleansing, data integration and management
Maintain existing data pipelines, and develop new data pipeline using big data technologies
Responsible for leading the effort of continuously improving reliability, scalability, and stability of micro services and platform
Contribute to and lead the continuous improvement of the software development framework and processes by analyzing, designing and developing test cases and implementing automated test suites
Reproduce, troubleshoot and determine root cause of production issues
Participate daily standup team meeting/bi-weekly sprint planning & sprint-end demo/retrospective and work cross-functionality with other teams in Lattice to drive the innovations of our products
Qualifications for this role:
Must want to be actively hands-on code using Java (70-90%)
Experience building data pipeline framework for data workflow to process large-data sets
Willingness and passion for mentoring junior engineers and performing code reviews
Possess strong knowledge in either Apache Spark or Hadoop
Strong expertise with 5+ years of experience in building enterprise techniques for large scale distributed system design and data processing
Strong knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, Object Oriented programming and design
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-driven, willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Desired but not all required: Hands-on experience with Scala, Cascading, AWS, DynamoDB, Redshift, Redis, Akka, MongoDB, Airflow, Pytorch, Scikit-Learn, MapReduce, Metadata Management, Tensorflow, NoSQL, Cassandra, Machine Learning or similar
Must Have Skills:
Must have exp in Java, Spark, Hadoop, Spring, AWS, MicroServices, MUST be heavy coding 80-90% (please ask this during screen, and refrain from sending anyone that has been only around 50%), ability to mentor and lead junior engineers, strong comp sci fundamentals
Job Type: Full-time
Work Remotely:
Yes

Company: Kuaishou Technology
Position: Manager, Java Engineering(A/B Test)
Location: Palo Alto, CA
About the company:
Kuaishou is a short video social platform for all users to record and share their lives, with the core mission to "Capture the World, Share Your Story" to increase every individual's happiness through Big Data and AI technology.
Kuaishou is one of the world's leading life-sharing community with more than 300 million daily active users and more than 20 billion short videos at the end of January 2020.
Kuaishou enables users to record their daily lives in short videos and share memorable moments as well as interact with followers in real-time through live streaming. For the first time in history, users from all over the world are connected and their stories shared in the form of video at Kuaishou.
You may visit usrdc.kuaishou.com to learn more about us.
About the Team:
Kuaishou Big Data Group has become an important engine, in the recent years along with the rapid growing of the company, in the entire data process through data infrastructure, data engineering, data content and data applications. As a part of the Big Data Group, Data Platform team (in DA direction), is responsible to provide the company with leading big data analysis platform through algorithms and strategies implementation, including but not limited to AB analysis, attribution analysis, multi-dimensional analysis, user portraits, etc. With the continuous expansion of the business, we aim to contribute more in building a full-process data analysis platform in the future!
Job Responsibilities:
· Build and motivate team by sharing vision and set clear goals.
· Develop and optimize the online and offline AB experimental systems for all products
· Develop and optimize the production management system for AB data indicators
· Lead the discussion and implementation of experimental methods
Requirements:
· Master’s degree in computer science or related majors with 5+ years of Java development experience
· Solid knowledge in Java foundations. Good understanding of IO and multi-threading, and a certain understanding of JVM principles
· Proficient in network programming and multi-threaded programming under Linux environment
· Experienced in commonly used back-end development technologies: protocol, architecture, storage, caching, security, etc.
· Experience in people manager will be a plus.
Additional Preferred Skills:
· Have a good sense of product
· Big data related background is preferred
· A good team player with a strong sense of ownership and commitment
· Passionate for big data technology

Job Title: Sr. Technical Product Manager (Data/BI) with mortgage industry experience
Job Description:
Senior Technical Product Manager, Data and BI
Location: United States - Fully remote
Reports to (Position): Sr. Dir. BI and Insights
Type: Full-time employee, direct hire
Note: Mortgage experience is required for this role!
Position Summary:
TekInclusion’s client is a planet-friendly Fintech Company, and an industry leader in financing for U.S. residential solar installations. Their Business Intelligence and Data teams are responsible for delivering innovative, best-in-class solutions across various platforms to power world-positive lending.
In their own words:
We are obsessed with enabling fast paced business decision-making, delivering business changing insights and supporting a driven and data hungry organization with the highest quality data, decision support, analysis and models. We want everyone in the organization to have access to data and decision support tools that allow them to outperform the competition, now and into the future.
We are looking for a senior, technically minded, product and internal customer champion to help shape the product roadmap and vision for our data warehousing, pipelining, and dashboarding solutions, to drive data engineering and analytics projects and product development and to own the user experience of one of our home-grown business intelligence platform. Our BI platform sits at the center of our business and is used every day by everyone in the organization from rank and file all the way up to the C suite. As the product owner of this platform you will interact with senior business leaders from across the organization and be a part of both a growing data / business intelligence team, and a growing product team. This role will hold responsibility for providing detailed roadmap planning for both our BI platform and the growing set of data systems that feed it. Must be a consummate product professional who truly embraces the ownership mindset, communicates clearly, obsesses over detail and who is passionate about making the world a better place through world positive, friendly financing and investing. This role requires extreme attention to detail, excellent communication and process-oriented thinking.
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Product Strategy – Work closely with senior leaders to set ambitious and clear product vision for growing, improving, and scaling our internal business intelligence and analytics platform, and our data ecosystem and ETL pipelines. Provide detailed roadmaps and communication of work being done. Be in tune with internal business customer needs for decision support, as well as best practices and platform technologies to ensure our internal BI and pipeline solutions remain world-class.
Execution – Be responsible for development including discovery, requirements gathering, prioritization and management of development for new reporting and dashboarding content, features, and associated data sources and pipelines, as well as managing bug reports and resolution, story writing and ticketing. Ensure rigor in execution and attention to detail by effectively managing the feature backlog. Work closely with key stakeholders to ensure alignment and manage expectations. Work closely with partners across the board, including UX, Sales, Marketing, Business Development, Legal, Engineering, etc.
Leadership – Motivate the data engineering and analytics squads to leverage individual strengths to overcome challenges. Model team norms and contribute to positive team dynamics, leading to continuous team performance improvement. Foster an environment of trust, effectively communicating within the squads and with an ecosystem of stakeholders.
Communication and Reporting – Regularly provide updates to senior leaders, stakeholders, partners, squad members, etc. Effectively tailor communications to the appropriate audience to ensure broad alignment, awareness, and advocacy of the product.
Partnership – Support client-facing employees in delivering for our clients (specifically client data exchange) by integrating the end to end client experience.
Required Skills:
Must be PASSIONATE about data!
Mortgage experience is required.
4+ years of Technical Product Manager experience
Must have solid SQL, Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis skills
Methodical thinker capable of handling complex analytical concepts, making difficult risk/reward decisions, and giving expert advice to others on the same
Comfortable setting direction at a project level, providing feedback on projects outside of their core area, and weighing in on key decisions that impact other teams and the company at large
Identifies and proactively tackles future issues before they grow into something even bigger, getting buy-in on solutions where appropriate
Knows how to weigh business risk mitigation work / platform improvement vs feature deliverables
Consistently able to reduce complexity of projects/processes to get more done with less work
Regularly delivers work as and when required; if not possible expectations are always managed and the reasons why clearly articulated
Is able to facilitate cross-team work, improving the effectiveness of others
Curiosity, tenacity and desire to understand business processes and outcomes, and interest in developing a deep understanding of organizational context
Outstanding verbal and written communication to both non-technical and executive audiences, able to communicate complex messages and trade-offs, and be able to tell a compelling story
Knowledge of financial systems, processes, data a plus
Technical background including work and experience in data engineering, analytics, and or data science with a keen understanding of broader business needs and strategy
Understanding of foundational data storage, transmission, and management concepts.
Understanding of data visualization and front end development concepts.
Proficient in defining well-thought out user stories, with thorough acceptance criteria and use cases
Education Level: Bachelors Degree Required
Field of Study/Area of Experience: 5-7 years of experience
Sorry, no third parties.

Pay: $140,000.00 - $170,000.00 per year

Dental insurance

Vision insurance

8 hour shift

Position Overview: The Business Support Analyst is responsible for Analyzing Management Performance through consistent, timely support to the Contact Center team and by providing business analysis that will assist with driving exceptional performance to maximize conversion rate.
The primary responsibilities will include understanding all available reporting tools and using them to generate meaningful reports designed to maximize productivity and make improvements to the operation. This position will report directly to the Head of Contact Center Operations and will also encompass preparing presentation materials, managing administrative functions, organizing meetings, and developing a cadence for required administrative functions such as performance reviews, tactical planning sessions and other key meetings Contact Center operations. This person will ensure internal and external key performance indicators are attained while delivering against the company’s tactical business plans.
Specific Responsibilities:
Ensure key performance metrics for the RCA contact centers are being clearly and accurately supplied in a timely and consistent manner at a departmental, team, and individual basis including: sales, quality, productivity, customer experience, and financials.
Gather and analyze data to solve complex problems and evaluate scenarios to make predictions on future outcomes and support decision making.
Ensure the operating procedures are consistent and company standards are being met or exceeded.
Analyze a broad range of customer and program data to determine customer impact, phone representative performance, to develop recommendations, and help management make improvements.
Analyze and seek answers on financial variances and initiate operational change to increase revenue and/or reduce cost and improve financial results.
Ensure attainment of internal and external key performance indicators on a daily, weekly and monthly, and annual basis.
Help produce and maintain a comprehensive Business Plan and Tactical Plan
Daily production and analysis of business and client results to ensure business objectives are met
Ensuring equipment, supplies and technology are ready at all times
Prepare standard and ad-hoc reports to meeting business requirements.
Be willing to participate in a minimum 4 hours of call taking and 4 hours of call listening each month.
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience:
Required:
Bachelor’s degree or 3+ years minimum inbound Call Center experience or Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Management Science, Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, Statistics or similar field.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office software
Must be flexible to work extended hours
Must be highly-proficient on computers, intermediate to advanced proficiency of Microsoft Office applications (word processing, spreadsheets, and database systems). Technical and software experience required
Strong planning, time management and organizational skills
The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing
Three (3) years developing and deploying BI Solutions with at least one of the following applications: Qlikview, Qlik Sense, Microsoft Power BI, Tableau
Strong SQL development experience isn MSSQL (SSRS/SSIS/SSAS)
Preferred:
Proficiency in SQL database design and SQL programming, including stored procedure and table joins
Experience working in a substance abuse facility, Crisis Center, Emergency Room, Triage unit, EMT, 911 Call Center environment
Experience (professionally or personally) in the treatment of addiction or mental health
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
Strong analytical, problem solving, decision-making and time management skills
Ability to plan well and prioritize work
Ability to work independently and within a team
Ability to work under pressure
Ability to multi-task and appropriately prioritize responsibilities in a fast-paced environment, with strong focus on attention to detail, and excellent communication skills
Accurate and fast computer skills

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Business Unit: Development
Reports to: CTO
Overview: The Associate Data Scientist utilizes their technical and architecture skills to process, sanitize, and visualize data. Their work will involve building ETL pipelines to normalize and transform raw data, develop scripts to analyze, sanitize, and validate data, and create dashboards to help provide visual insights for Constellation Agency's employees and customers. Perform other duties as assigned.
Essential Functions
Collaborate with product teams, data analysts, and other data scientists to model data and conceptualize dashboards.
Organize, model, and build dashboards that visualize data and insights.
Design and maintain ETL processes.
Recommend new solutions and process to develop and enhance our existing portfolio.
Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Work as part of a team in a fast-paced startup environment.
Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality.
Qualifications:
Education/Experience: 2 years of previous professional experience in a development or data science role with listed technologies.
Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Deadline and detail orientated.
Mathematical Skills: Strong algorithm and problem-solving skills
Technical Skills: Business Insights platforms such as PowerBI, Tableau, and Looker
SQL, Data notebooks such as Jupyter, Data Warehouses such as
Amazon Redshift, Azure Data Warehouse, Google BigQuery, and
Snowflake, Scripting languages such as Python, specifically with pandas and NumPy
Reasoning Ability: Must be able to work independently with minimal supervision.
Must be able to anticipate and solve problems.

Involves close vision, color vision, depth perception, and focus adjustment. Must be able to move and/or lift at least 10 lbs.
Other skills: Knowledge and experience of databases and modeling data.
Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

Job Summary
Support the Federal Electronic Health Records Modernization (FEHRM) program office through the analysis and evaluation of data standards and their impact on the implementation of the single, common electronic health record (EHR) across the DOD, VA, and Coast Guard, as well as other aspects of interoperability across the federal sector. Leverage experience with the Office of National Coordination (ONC) to develop strategic planning approaches that consider key factors from across the federal interoperability space and inform the next generation of the FEHRM’s role with interoperability. In coordination with the Departments, apply principles of medical informatics to healthcare information technology with the goal of improving patient care by leveraging the EHR to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of treatment. Liaise with standards development organizations (SDOs) as FEHRM representation to advocate for the interests of the Departments and report information that could impact the implementation of the EHR product to relevant parties. Coordinate across the FEHRM to facilitate a cohesive approach to data standards that aligns with the broader FEHRM interoperability goals. Apply expertise to development of strategic planning for the FEHRM’s data standards and interoperability teams and ensure tactical activities are accomplished in a timely manner.
Qualifications and Skills
· Minimum of 4 years of experience is required. An additional 12 years of relevant experience may be substituted for degree requirements.
· Experience in DOD, VA, or both
· Experience with electronic health records
· Experience with ONC and understanding of ONC policies and activities related to interoperability.
· Understanding of the federal interoperability space and ability to identify gaps and opportunities to improve interoperability.
· Ability to critically and analytically evaluate business drivers, requirements, and stakeholder viewpoints across multiple organizations to provide strategic perspective, creative problem solving, and potential courses of action.
· Excellent communication skills, including ability to present at meetings and workshops on project work and participate in discussions.
· Ability to coordinate with technical professionals and create new approaches and solutions.
· Ability to produce scientific writing, visual presentations (e.g., infographics), and publication submissions (e.g., AMIA, PLOS, HIMSS, Health Affairs)
· Ability to work independently using organizational and time management skills.
· PhD in healthcare, science, computer engineering or related scientific, technical, or clinical discipline
Additional Qualifications:
· Knowledge and experience in terminology standards and current and emerging health data standards
· Knowledge of patient-level healthcare delivery and the interaction of clinical workflows with EHRs
· Knowledge of appropriate data sources to address the specific requirements of projects for monitoring, characterization, analysis, and modeling.
· Knowledge of Cerner capabilities, such as Cerner’s open platforms (Cerner Millennium®, HealtheIntent, CareAware®), Ignite APIs for Millennium, Open Engine, and OPENLink™
Knowledge of CommonWell Health Alliance

Job Title: Practice Lead, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML)
Job Description:
About the Role
EGlobalTech (EGT), a Tetra Tech Company, is searching for an Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) Practice Lead to join our R&D Lab, EGTLabs, and support our Technology, Cyber, and Business Solutions Practices. This role will make an immediate impact on customer engagements and the entire organization. This position works with Executive Leadership to develop solutions in machine learning and data science using cutting edge open source technologies for some of our nation’s most pressing issues. Qualified candidates should have expert level experience deploying AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure. We are looking for an innovative leader that wants to #BePartOfTheSolution! EGT offers excellent compensation, career growth potential, and a benefits package that includes PTO and Holidays, continuing training and education reimbursements, 401K match after just 90 days, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) and more!
Check out more about EGTLabs below:
https://www.eglobaltech.com/egtlabs
Responsibilities
The Practice Lead, AI/ML will work regularly with an existing customer in the aviation industry to develop and deploy AI solutions with a strong focus on natural language processing (NLP) within Amazon Web Services (AWS) infrastructure.
This role will act as the lead for multiple AI challenges and be responsible for developing innovative solutions to solve our client's most critical problems.
Develop new open source products that scale and are repeatable across a wide customer space
Develop and deploy AI products for a leading customer in the aviation space.
Lead demos and discussions around AI, machine learning, and data science with existing and new customers.
Develop prototypes and demos in Amazon Web Services (AWS) using Python.
Contribute technical expertise to proposals, white papers, and business development activities.
Hands-on algorithm development.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or relevant field
10+ years of experience developing Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning (AI/ML) models and solutions for high visibility stakeholders, preferably for a federal consulting firm.
3+ years of experience working with and developing software prototypes and solutions.
Must have a deep understanding of Python.
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
This position requires a badge and or clearance that will require an extensive background, credit, and drug screening requirement.
About Us
EGlobalTech (EGT), a Tetra Tech Company, is a leading management and IT consulting firm in the Washington, D.C. metropolitan area. Our focus is to provide the public sector with innovative solutions, leveraging cutting-edge tools and methodologies to meet the Government’s most pressing business needs. To achieve this objective, our core practice areas – strategy, IT solutions development, cyber security, and cloud computing – are integrated to provide clients with comprehensive end-to-end results. This integration enables our highly motivated teams to thrive in a culture that encourages out-of-the-box thinking, collaboration and an environment where you can excel. For more information, please visit our website at www.eglobaltech.com
Equal Employment Opportunity:

You will work with our top engineers across our application, platform, data science, and UI teams to implement a cutting-edge customer data platform that will challenge you and your teammates technically and intellectually. Our culture is built on mentorship, so you should be prepared to learn from others and also teach others. Responsible for leading the design and development of a Big Data predictive analytics SaaS based customer data platform using object oriented analysis, design and programming skills, and design patterns

Experience building data pipeline framework for data workflow to process large-data sets

Possess strong knowledge in either Apache Spark or Hadoop
Strong expertise with 5+ years of experience in building enterprise techniques for large scale distributed system design and data processing
Strong knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, Object Oriented programming and design
Strong analytical and problem solving skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Must Have Skills:
Must have exp in Java, Spark, Hadoop, Spring, AWS, MicroServices, MUST be heavy coding 80-90% (please ask this during screen, and refrain from sending anyone that has been only around 50%), ability to mentor and lead junior engineers, strong comp sci fundamentals

We need your help! We’re looking for a self-motivated and detail-oriented data engineer to join our DataOps team. This opportunity will enable you contribute to the operation, support, and enhancement of our mission critical data operations platform and the development of data pipelines. Our data operations platform supports high volume, high velocity data ingestion and curation to support our existing, and rapidly expanding, health plan client base.
What You’ll Do
As a data engineer, you will be responsible for the execution and management of inbound client and internal service-based data pipelines. This encompasses the development, operation, and management of our client data hubs, including data intake, data quality assessment/evaluation and data curation and enrichment/preparation processes. Our client data hubs consist of various health plan data sources to support Decision Point services including our AI/ML platform, analytics platform, and OPUS application. If this interests you, read on.
The Position
Design and develop scalable data integration (ETL/ELT) processes (including ingestion, cleansing, curation, unification, etc.)
Automate the processing of inbound client data feeds
Design and develop tools to support data profiling and data quality methodologies
Work with our data science team to assist with data prep, enrichment and feature engineering for AI/ML
Engage with our software engineering team to ensure precise data points per application specification
Provide periodic support to our customer success team
Skills & Experience
BS / MS in Computer Science, Engineering or applicable experience
3+ years of experience with ETL/ELT and data pipeline principles
3+ years of experience with Python, JavaScript, and/or PowerShell
3+ years of SQL experience; Microsoft SQL Server or PostgreSQL preferred
Knowledge of data manipulation methodologies
Excellent verbal and written communication
Strong data profiling skills; Ability to discover and highlight unique patterns/trends within data to identify and solve complex problems
Keen understanding of EDW and other database design principles
Comfortable working with very large data sets and VLDB environments
Experience with CI/CD and version control tools: Git preferred
Understanding of data science and machine learning concepts preferred
Experience working within hybrid cloud environment; AWS experience is a plus
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau or QuickSight is a plus
Familiarity with healthcare data is a plus
Some familiarity with statistical software tools and libraries such as R and scikit-learn is a plus

Job Title: Big Data Principal Software Engineer
Location: Remote
Duration: Full Time
Description:
You will work with our top engineers across our application, platform, data science, and UI teams to implement a cutting-edge customer data platform that will challenge you and your teammates technically and intellectually. Daily you will be working with other engineers, product managers, and QA to invent the best solutions for our customers and advance our leadership position in CDP and ABM fields. You should feel confident in your development skills and also open to diverse opinions so that you can make the decisions on how to build our best solutions. Our culture is built on mentorship, so you should be prepared to learn from others and also teach others. As a Senior/Lead Software Engineer you will be expected to work on projects as a technical lead and give guidance to other members on technical design and overall on best practices.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for leading the design and development of a Big Data predictive analytics SaaS based customer data platform using object oriented analysis, design and programming skills, and design patterns
Implement ETL workflows for data matching, data cleansing, data integration and management
Maintain existing data pipelines, and develop new data pipeline using big data technologies
Responsible for leading the effort of continuously improving reliability, scalability, and stability of micro services and platform
Contribute to and lead the continuous improvement of the software development framework and processes by analyzing, designing and developing test cases and implementing automated test suites
Reproduce, troubleshoot and determine root cause of production issues
Participate daily standup team meeting/bi-weekly sprint planning & sprint-end demo/retrospective and work cross-functionality with other teams in Lattice to drive the innovations of our products
Qualifications for this role:
Must want to be actively hands-on code using Java (70-90%)
Experience building data pipeline framework for data workflow to process large-data sets
Willingness and passion for mentoring junior engineers and performing code reviews
Possess strong knowledge in either Apache Spark or Hadoop
Strong expertise with 5+ years of experience in building enterprise techniques for large scale distributed system design and data processing
Strong knowledge of common algorithms, data structures, Object Oriented programming and design
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to hit the ground running and learn/adapt quickly
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-driven, willing to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Desired but not all required: Hands-on experience with Scala, Cascading, AWS, DynamoDB, Redshift, Redis, Akka, MongoDB, Airflow, Pytorch, Scikit-Learn, MapReduce, Metadata Management, Tensorflow, NoSQL, Cassandra, Machine Learning or similar
Must Have Skills:
Must have exp in Java, Spark, Hadoop, Spring, AWS, MicroServices, MUST be heavy coding 80-90% (please ask this during screen, and refrain from sending anyone that has been only around 50%), ability to mentor and lead junior engineers, strong comp sci fundamentals
Job Type: Full-time
Work Remotely:
Yes

Senior Software Engineer
NanoMosaic LLC, located in Woburn, Massachusetts, is focused on developing an innovative photonics technology for biomedical diagnostics and drug development. Our cutting-edge technology will enable new frontiers of medical research for ultrahigh-sensitivity detection of single molecules in low volume liquid biopsy samples.
We are looking for a candidate with a strong desire to bring a disruptive technology to market; playing a key role in a multidisciplinary team. This position will primarily focus on implementation of our data processing, informatics, and reporting pipeline.
Successful candidates must have solid knowledge and extensive experience with scripting in Python or similar language with special emphasis in machine vision applications. Emphasis is also placed on image processing techniques via machine learning methods as well as local and hosted system architecture development. Experience providing consumer-facing data visualizations is preferred. Additionally, candidates should possess a strong acumen for on-the-fly problem solving, communication, and system level thinking.
Responsibilities:
 Develop, validate, implement, and support image analysis tools for our evolving data pipeline
 Incorporate data pipeline revisions into our existing platform
 Develop and integrate data reporting mechanism
General Qualifications:
 Creative, hardworking, and organized. Must also show a track record of innovative problem solving in technical environments.
 BS/BA degree in a Data Science or related field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics,
Bioinformatics, etc.)
 5+ years of directly related experience
 Strong experience with image processing and image analysis
 Strong background in Python, C/C++, Visual Studio Code, etc…
 Strong problem-solving skills
 Experience working in Linux systems
 Experience with full software development lifecycle including requirements, design, implementation, testing, and deployment.
 Experience specifying hardware requirements and working with hardware engineers.
 Ability to prioritize tasks and deliver in a small working group
 Excellent communication skills are essential
 Experience with software version control (GIT preferred).
Preferred Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree in a Software Engineering or related field (e.g. Computer Science, Statistics,
Mathematics, Bioinformatics, etc.) plus 5 years of experience.
 Previous experience in ground up application development of machine control, data acquisition, statistical methods and machine learning techniques
 Application experience machine vision, and microscopy
 Experience with other software platforms such as LabView, Matlab
 Familiarity with regulatory framework and guidance for RUO and Dx software development
